items.title: Car thieves going high-tech
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Liberals divided over Labor's plan to outlaw inciting racial hatred
items.summary: After weeks criticising the Albanese government over the Bondi attack and issues around antisemitism, the Coalition is split over whether proposed solutions are at odds with its interests in preserving freedom of speech.

items.title: Public transport bypassed in Labor's Mount Barker re-election promises
items.summary: Labor today announced a $200 million investment in Mount Barker as part of its bid to win the seat of Kavel, but while some of those initiatives have been welcomed, there was a glaring omission in public transport solutions.

items.title: Chaos in Melbourne court as Brendan Nicholls is denied bail over alleged imam assault
items.summary: A Melbourne courtroom descended into chaos as the 23-year-old man accused of assaulting Ismet Purdic and his wife attempted to climb out of the dock moments after being denied bail.

items.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Chad Littmann pleads guilty to lighting two small fires in Royal National Park
items.summary: A magistrate tells a 48-year-old bus driver prison is his "only possible sentence" after he lit two small fires near Sydney in December.

items.title: Sydney Festival show asses.masses combines participatory theatre and the social fabric of playing video games together
items.summary: Theatre makers Patrick Blenkarn and Milton Lim have built a game to be played socially in an auditorium, with a single player leading a group of donkeys on a journey of discovery.

items.title: Ruffy community determined to rebuild after Longwood bushfire destroys Victorian town
items.summary: Residents in the central Victorian community of Ruffy say they are determined to rebuild after a bushfire destroyed most buildings in the small community.

items.title: Venus Williams exits Hobart International after straight-sets loss to Tatjana Maria
items.summary: After being awarded a wildcard at the age of 45, seven-time major singles champion Venus Williams falls in the opening round in Hobart.

items.title: Jasper Jones author Craig Silvey faces Fremantle court over alleged child exploitation offences
items.summary: One of Australia's most renowned authors, Craig Silvey, faces court after he allegedly distributed child exploitation material.

items.title: Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network says it will disband due to proposed hate speech laws
items.summary: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

items.title: Australian Open qualifying: Cruz Hewitt knocked out in first round, Storm Hunter returns with a win
items.summary: It is the second year in a row Hewitt has been knocked out in the first round of qualifying, but the match against a much higher-ranked opponent can only do good things for him.

items.title: Carnarvon growers enjoy massive mango season, bringing prices down for consumers
items.summary: A WA mango grower is pleasantly surprised to find a crop full of massive mangoes, as big as a bowling ball.

items.title: Iranian Australians wary of foreign intervention or regime change amid fear for relatives
items.summary: Some members of the Iranian diaspora in Australia are wary of foreign intervention in Iran, but others say there may not be another choice.

items.title: Iranian Australians in Melbourne protest in defiance of government crackdown
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Koala captured on motion-sensor camera in rare sighting near Canberra
items.summary: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

items.title: l decluttered my wardrobe and said goodbye to 'fantasy me'
items.summary: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

items.title: Police say no ongoing threat to public safety, 18yo man in custody after Pinjarra firearms incident
items.summary: Police say they have located an 18-year-old man wanted in connection with a firearms incident in Pinjarra on Tuesday morning.

items.title: Bridge fire near tourist town of Byron Bay highlights region's homelessness crisis
items.summary: A bridge used daily by thousands of drivers is shut in northern NSW, after a fire beneath it destroys the camps of two homeless men with "nowhere else to go".

items.title: Couple linked to disgraced former Wagga Wagga MP Daryl Maguire banned from managing corporations
items.summary: A husband and wife are banned from managing corporations for five years after the failure of several companies, one of which was linked to the former Wagga Wagga MP.

items.title: Suzi Milgate receives suspended sentence for crepe attack on former NT chief minister
items.summary: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe is sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

items.title: Tasmanian pianist takes outdoor performances to striking mainland locations
items.summary: Kelvin Smith played a baby grand piano at some incredible sites across Tasmania before bringing his impromptu shows to amazing mainland locations.

items.title: Mount Alexander fire knocks out TV and radio across central Victoria
items.summary: A fast-moving fire has silenced free-to-air TV and radio across central Victoria — and it could take months to fix the site.

items.title: Fears of unseen violence against protesters as Iran's internet blackout enters a fifth day
items.summary: Human rights groups estimate more than 500 people have been killed and more than 10,600 arrested in the ongoing protests.

items.title: Rudd leaves US-Australia relationship in good shape ahead of Trump's China visit
items.summary: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

items.title: SA premier becomes emotional in press conference
items.summary: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

items.title: Minnesota and the Twin Cities sue US federal government to stop immigration crackdown
items.summary: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

items.title: Record number of black and grey-headed flying foxes die during east coast heatwave
items.summary: Wildlife rescuers warn extreme heat could kill more black and grey-headed flying foxes across NSW, with 700 dead animals already removed from two Illawarra camps.

items.title: Former A-League player Josh Cavallo alleges Adelaide United was homophobic
items.summary: Australia's first openly gay male professional footballer, Josh Cavallo, has alleged his former club was homophobic, something it denies.

items.title: Regional NSW boy accused of hoax emergency calls about mass shootings at US institutions
items.summary: A "young boy" from regional New South Wales is accused of making fake emergency calls claiming mass shootings were taking place at major retail and education institutions in the United States.

items.title: Alyssa Healy's path to Australian cricket greatness was far from straightforward
items.summary: Alyssa Healy was thrust into headlines when she was just 16 for daring to break into a literal old boys' club, but has expertly handled the national spotlight with bat, ball and microphone in hand.

items.title: Global financial system hangs in balance as Federal Reserve independence challenged
items.summary: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

items.title: Kevin Rudd to resign a year early as Australian ambassador to the US
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says it was Kevin Rudd's own decision to resign from the role on March 31, a year earlier than planned.

items.title: British and Irish dual citizens bear costly brunt of UK passport changes
items.summary: British Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

items.title: Fears fish protection measures could threaten Eden Creek Weir platypus population
items.summary: Landholders living alongside a northern NSW creek say a government plan to demolish a weir to improve fish migration will be devastating for the local platypus population.

items.title: Thousands of ACT childcare documents show behind the scenes of embattled industry
items.summary: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

items.title: How the Iranian regime uses the dead in its intimidation and propaganda machine
items.summary: As images of rows and rows of dead bodies at a morgue in Tehran circulate, the regime is accused of making it impossible for families to grieve.

items.title: Details of Labor's new hate speech and gun laws revealed
items.summary: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Alyssa Healy retiring from all cricket after upcoming series against India
items.summary: Australia captain Alyssa Healy announces she will retire from all forms of cricket after a multi-format series against India in February and March.

items.title: Man faces court over fatal stabbing at Mount Druitt as police release CCTV of hooded men
items.summary: Police have released CCTV of three men dressed in dark hoodies, who they believe can assist with inquiries.

items.title: Elite female athletes speak out about struggles with body image and disordered eating
items.summary: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

items.title: Japan's journey from unlicensed 'baby hotels' to delivering restaurant-quality childcare food
items.summary: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

items.title: Gazans beg for shelter as winter storms batter millions and Israel limits aid
items.summary: Homeless Gazans are begging the Israeli government to allow proper shelters into the strip as winter storms batter the enclave and destroy many people's tents.

items.title: First Venezuela, then the US Fed — what the White House attacks mean for us
items.summary: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

items.title: Geography quiz: How well do you know this wide, brown land?
items.summary: How well do you know this wide, brown land?

items.title: Greenland rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'
items.summary: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

items.title: The Gambia alleges Myanmar undertook a genocidal campaign against the Rohingya people at ICJ
items.summary: The case is being watched closely to see how the court might handle other genocide allegations against Israel.

items.title: Iran's blackout has sparked fears of what may be found in the aftermath. There is also hope for the return of Reza Pahlavi
items.summary: Iranians have endured a blackout but for many the fears of atrocities committed by the Khamenei regime are real and based on reports of machine guns being used.

items.title: NT government rejects Albanese's national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal
items.summary: The Northern Territory government says it does not support the Commonwealth's proposed national gun buyback scheme, stating the territory should not have to share the cost 50:50.

items.title: Couple heartbroken after new Harcourt home destroyed by Ravenswood fire
items.summary: The couple was supposed to spend their first official night in the new home on Friday. It was destroyed by an out-of-control grassfire that afternoon.

items.title: Australian Open qualifying: Bernard Tomic cruises through first round against Hugo Dellier
items.summary: Bernard Tomic looked in control throughout and comfortably moved his way into the second round of qualifying at Melbourne Park.

items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Health expert says 'it's a mystery' why WA is falling behind eastern states on illegal tobacco laws
items.summary: An eastern states public health expert says "it's a mystery" why Western Australia is lagging behind the rest of the country on updating its illicit tobacco laws.

items.title: Imam thanks police after alleged roadside assault in Melbourne's south-east
items.summary: An imam who was allegedly the victim of racial abuse during a roadside assault has thanked the police who helped him and his wife, and urged Australians to reject hate, Islamophobia and antisemitism.

items.title: Max Hobson identified as cattle farmer who died in Longwood fire near Seymour
items.summary: Max Hobson has been identified as the person whose body was found metres from a car following the Longwood bushfire.

items.title: Labor pledges fertility treatment rebates as SA state election nears
items.summary: Families will be able to access fertility treatment rebates of up to $2,000 per cycle for two cycles, under a Labor promise announced ahead of the upcoming state election.

items.title: Investigation underway after woman found dead at house in Buccan, south of Brisbane
items.summary: An investigation is underway after a woman was found dead at a house in Buccan, south of Brisbane.

items.title: Herbal remedy ArmaForce causes severe reaction for Perth woman
items.summary: A popular supplement linked to hundreds of adverse events is again in the spotlight after a Perth woman was hospitalised after taking over-the-counter herbal remedy ArmaForce.

items.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese recalls parliament to introduce hate speech and gun laws
items.summary: Anthony Albanese has recalled parliament early to deal with sweeping hate speech and gun laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Federal minister backs decision to axe Palestinian author from Adelaide writers' festival
items.summary: Resources Minister Madeleine King's comments come amid a growing furore over the decision that has led several board members to resign and dozens of writers to withdraw from the Adelaide literary event.

items.title: Rose Byrne wins best comedy nod for If I Had Legs I'd Kick You, and other key moments from the Golden Globes
items.summary: This year's Golden Globes saw hits and misses for Australia, last-minute snubs and a humbled Timothée Chalamet.

items.title: How I have fun with friends without spending money
items.summary: I've kept low-cost, high-fun habits alive for years, even after returning home to a city where socialising often seems to mean shelling out.

items.title: Iran's mass protests are not just about a repressive theocratic regime
items.summary: Understanding how events unfold in Iran requires understanding how its society and economy have reconfigured in the 47 years since the Islamic revolution.

items.title: Trump administration sending more agents to Minneapolis despite outrage over fatal shooting
items.summary: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem says hundreds more federal agents are heading to Minneapolis, brushing aside demands by the city's Democratic leaders to leave after an immigration officer fatally shot a female protester.

items.title: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, praised for Bondi Junction stabbing response, diagnosed with breast cancer
items.summary: NSW Police Inspector Amy Scott, who was praised for bringing the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing attack to an end, has been diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of breast cancer.
